div.class: post clearfix post-23050 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-supts-on

a.title: Permalink to Update from Dr. Fisher

div.p: Hi Gibbon Nation.

Wow.Â These past several weeks have been interesting and panic associated with COVID-19 challenged a sense of normalcy for the entire world.Â What was considered normal a few weeks ago is no longer normal today.Â That is especially true for educators and public schools. (Read More by clicking the title of this post)

div.class: post clearfix post-23019 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to Honoring Senior Class of 2020 #BeTheLight

div.p: Gibbon Nation.Â Beginning Monday, April 20th,Â and each Monday through May 4th,Â Gibbon Public Schools will participate in the #BeTheLight Movement as we honor the Senior Class of 2020.Â The lights at Gibbon Field will be turned on from 8:20 pm â€“ 8:40 pm to â€œshine a lightâ€™ on the tremendous group of seniors who have bright futures.Â 8:20 pm is 20:20 military time and this gesture is one way of honoring the Class of 2020â€“a group of young people we are very proud of.Â GO BUFFALOES.

div.class: post clearfix post-23017 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-board-agendas

a.title: Permalink to Board of Education Meeting Agendaâ€“April 16

div.p: Board Meeting Agenda â€” April 16

div.class: post clearfix post-23010 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to Board Meeting â€“ April 16

div.p: NOTICE OF BOARD MEETING

The School District of Gibbon
in the Counties of
Buffalo and Kearney
in the State of Nebraska

NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the meeting of the Board of Education of Gibbon, in the Counties of Buffalo and Kearney, in the State of Nebraska, will be held on the 16th of April, 2020 at 7:00 p.m. at the Gibbon Public School, 1030 Court in the Distance Learning classroom which meeting is open to the public.
An agenda for such meeting, kept continuously current is available
at the Office of the Superintendent.

Brian Kroll
President of the Board

div.class: post clearfix post-23000 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to 2020 Graduation Ceremony

div.p: Due to extenuating circumstances and the COVID-19 pandemic, Gibbon Public Schools has made the decision to postpone the 2020 Graduation Ceremony until Saturday, July 25th at 1:00 PM.Â This decision is dependent upon the impact of social distancing, the duration of District Health Measures, or directives issued by the Governor and the Nebraska Department of Education.Â We take the health and well being of our students and community members very seriously and also want to honor the tradition of graduation. Please monitor the districtâ€™s website for future news about graduation.

div.class: post clearfix post-22998 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to FBLA Chapter ZOOM Meeting Wednesday

div.p: The FBLA April Chapter Meeting is scheduled for today, April 8, for all FBLA members at 3:00 pm. This meeting will be a ZOOM Video Conference and all members are asked to check Schoology for the ZOOM ID number.

div.class: post clearfix post-22994 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to Summer Driverâ€™s Education Update

div.p: Currently, the Nebraska Safety Center is planning to hold summer driverâ€™s education classes. We are looking into other options besides in-person classes but nothing has been finalized yet. Refunds will be available to students if they decide to cancel their enrollment, however, please allow 4-6 weeks for the refund to be processed and returned to them. The Nebraska DMV is still issuing first-time driving permits at certain locations. Students should go toÂ dmv.nebraska.govÂ to see what locations are issuing permits and if an appointment is required. Students do not need to get their first permit from the DMV in the county they reside in, any Nebraska DMV will issue permits. We will keep you informed as new information becomes available.

div.class: post clearfix post-22991 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to Seeking Secondary Principal For 2020-2021

div.p:
Gibbon Public Schools is seeking a highly qualified educational leader to serve as 7-12 High School Principal for the 2020-21 school year.Â Gibbon High School is a 1 to 1 learning environment utilizing iPads and laptops.Â Required qualities include expertise in curriculum, instruction, personnel management, the collaborative teamwork process and the building of community/parental partnerships.Â A dedication and commitment to school improvement and an understanding of the NE standards, assessment, and reporting system is desired. Click here for more details regarding this position and the application process:Â Secondary Principal Position.
This position is subject to Veterans preference.Â EOE

div.class: post clearfix post-22982 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to NSAA Cancels All Activities

span.strong: Per Jay Bellar Executive Director of the NSAA:

p.span: All remaining NSAA activity practices and competitions, including district and state competitions, have been cancelled for this school year. These cancellations are part of a new Directed Health Measure issued by Governor Ricketts.Â Â

div.class: post clearfix post-22978 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to GPS Communication Plan

div.p:
The CoronaVirus Pandemic has forced theÂ school district to indefinitely close its doors. Despite this reality, education for all our students will continue to occur through an alternate learning environment.
READ MORE. . .

div.class: post clearfix post-22943 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to Positive Mindset Zoom Every Friday

div.p: Mrs. Waddle, the guidance counselor, will be having a Positive Mindset Zoom session every Friday. The session for the elementary will be at 1 pm and the high school at 2 pm. Be sure to watch Schoology and email for the Zoom ID.

div.p: Board Policy 611.05 (Alternate Learning Environment Grading Policy) has been added to the COVID-19 tab at the top of this page. Click here to view this policy in its entirety:Â ALE Grading Policy.

h2.a: Gibbon Fine Arts Booster Scholarship Available

div.p: The Gibbon Fine Arts Booster Club scholarship is now available. The application can be downloaded from the Students Tab â€“ 2020 Scholarships link at the top of the web page. Applications are due by May 1.

div.class: post clearfix post-22951 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-supts-on

a.title: Permalink to LEARNING WILL CONTINUE IN GIBBON PUBLIC SCHOOLS

h2.a: LEARNING WILL CONTINUE IN GIBBON PUBLIC SCHOOLS

div.p: I am sad to share Gibbon Public Schools will continue to operate without students in the building, and we are preparing for the fact this might be the case the remainder of the school year. While the building may be closed in the traditional sense, PLEASE COUNT ON INSTRUCTION TAKING PLACE TIlE REMAINDER OF THIS ACADEMIC YEAR. This means learning for all students will continue in an alternate setting, and instruction will occur through Zoom, instructional packets, and other venues identified by the classroom teacher.

Gibbon Public Schools just finished our first week in an alternate learning environment, and we understand the Coronavirus Pandemic has placed additional burdens on our families. After all, parents and guardians must work to provide shelter, clothing and food for their children. However, we canâ€™t ignore the ethical obligation to continue your childâ€™s education. It is extremely important that your children participate in the learning experiences designed by teachers. Failure to do so may impact your childâ€™s growth and development, ability to graduate, participation in extracurricular activities, or promotion to the next grade level.

The family of Gibbon Public Schools is saddened with how the 2019-20 school year will end for our students. Students enjoy coining to school, interacting with their friends, and visiting with their teachers. Students will miss out on experiencing traditional celebrations, participating in extra-curricular activities, and enjoying relationships nurtured this school year. While life has thrown us this new challenge, I am quite confident our entire community will respond in an admirable and heroic way. Please monitor your childâ€™s completion of assigned tasks and do not hesitate to contact the teacher if you have any questions. We want to prevent students from falling too far behind their peers. Thank You.

I have added additional information that will serve Gibbon Nation well as they consider the best approach to contacting the school district or securing new, current information about the school district Office Hours. The office will continue to perform daily operational tasks; however, this will occur in a non-traditional way.Â On Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, the office will be open from 7:30 a.m. to 4:00. Although we will not allow individuals inside the building, we will have secretarial and administrative staff available to take phone calls, answer emails, and respond to requests. On Tuesday and Thursday, our staff will work from home and will be able to respond to emails. Please do not hesitate to use email to contact one of us. Please leave a message if you are unable to connect with any individual.

p.br:

a.title: Permalink to GEF Continuing Education Scholarships

div.p: The Gibbon Educational Foundation (GEF) will be awarding several Continuing Education Scholarships to graduates of Gibbon Public Schools for the 2020-2021 academic year. The guidelines and application for these scholarships can be downloaded from this website. The application is located on the Students Tab â€“ 2020 Scholarships link at the top of this page. The deadline for applying is June 5.

a.title: Permalink to Counselor Help or Support

div.p: Students, if you need help or support, the guidance counselor wants to hear from you. Please use the following link to check in with Mrs. Waddle; it is a safe place to express how you are feeling or to share a story:Â COUNSELOR CHECK IN .
This link is also located under the Students Tab â€“ Counselorâ€™s Corner at the top of this web page.

div.class: post clearfix post-22923 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized

a.title: Permalink to Parents: Please Read Dr. Fisherâ€™s Letter on Social Distancing

h2.a: Parents: Please Read Dr. Fisherâ€™s Letter on Social Distancing

div.p: Dear Parent, Guardian, or Caregiver:

Social distancing is a major inconvenience. In fact itâ€™s a huge disruption. But social distancing interventions are absolutely necessary to slow the spread of COVID-19. Every one of us must do our part to slow the spread of this virus right now. This protects us and our loved ones who are at high risk for disease. . . READ MORE.
